word: Amazed and terrified at the command, Moses drew back. . . . Moses saw before him difficulties that seemed insurmountable. What proof could he give his people that God had indeed sent him? . . . Evidence that appealed to his own senses was now given. He was told to cast his rod upon the ground. As he did so, "it became a serpent; and Moses fled from before it." He was commanded to seize it, and in his hand it became a rod. . . . The Lord assured Moses that His own people, as well as Pharaoh, should be convinced that One mightier than the king of Egypt was manifest among them. . . .
